intro: Lathyrus vestitus var. ochropetalus, commonly known as the pale-petaled grass vetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers. The leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets, and the plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or through animal activity.
